summary: Gerald P. Hamilton was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears in multiple payroll certification reports from 1978 and 1979. The documents list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. He was employed by the committee during the period it was actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Gerald P. Hamilton's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
